866559204:
[

Senior Technician | Minerva Gas Plant | 4,5/5,4 Residential | Port Campbell

Company Name BHP Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 19 hours ago Number of views 15 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About BHP

At BHP we support our people to grow, learn, develop their skills and reach their potential. With a global portfolio of operations, we offer a diverse and inclusive environment with extraordinary career opportunities. Our strategy is to focus on creating a safe work environment where our employees feel strongly connected to our values and objectives, and where the capability of our people is key to our success. Come and be a part of this success.

About The Role

Reporting to the Operations Supervisor, you are responsible for operating and monitoring the performance of all plant and equipment in a safe and effective manner via the control systems (PCS, CSS, etc.) to meet gas nomination. You will also be expected to provide support and apply knowledge of maintenance planning to optimise maintenance tasks and quality of work.Other responsibilities include:
  • Prepare work permits and supporting control of work documentation for authorisation and manage work in accordance with site control work of work processes.
  • Ensure all relevant and/or required information including the status of ongoing tasks is effectively communicated on to the next shift at shift handover and where necessary to the support staff.
  • Monitor the progress of all work covered by work permits in accordance with the Minerva permit to work system.
  • Carry out the role specified in the emergency response plan during site emergencies.
  • Draft and review various OMS documents mainly for production operation and plant maintenance activities.
  • Gather and compile data for all Minerva Gas Plant production logs and reports.
  • Carry out troubleshooting and diagnosis of process and equipment faults and optimise the process systems within operating guidelines.
  • Communicate with the Operations Supervisor to optimise day-to-day gas and condensate production activities.
  • Assist in the training and development of new Trainee Production technicians and Field Technicians as required by the Operations Supervisor.
  • Ensure that all required routine tasks for the shift, including laboratory work, maintenance, housekeeping and other tasks as detailed by the operations management system are completed to required standard.
The Minerva development consists of two subsea wells in 60 meters of water, approximately 10 kilometers offshore from the township of Port Campbell. This role will be based at the Minerva Gas Plant on a 4 on, 5 off, 5 on, 4 off day/night 12 hour roster with an additional annual leave entitlement. You must have your own accommodation in Port Campbell / Warrnambool region to be considered for this 2 year fixed term role.

About You

As the successful candidate, you will posses:
  • Sound process experience in oil/gas/chemical processing.
  • Practical problem solving skills.
  • Trade or process plant operations qualified.
  • Good personal/interpersonal skills and is a team player.
  • Ability to work in a flexible small team based environment.
  • Positive and flexible work ethic.
  • Ability to read technical data/drawings.
  • Valid Australian driver’s license.

Supporting a diverse workforce

At BHP, we recognise that we are strengthened by diversity. We are committed to providing a work environment in which everyone is included, treated fairly and with respect. We are an Equal Opportunity employer and we encourage applications from women and Indigenous people. We know there are many aspects of our employees’ lives that are important, and work is only one of these, so we offer benefits to enable your work to fit with your life. These benefits include flexible working options, a generous paid parental leave policy, other extended leave entitlements and parent rooms.

Industry

  • Mining & Metals
  • Oil & Energy

Employment Type

Part-time

Job Functions

  • Information Technology

LAME B1R

Company Name Virgin Australia Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 71 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About The Role

As a LAME you will be approved for the certification of aircraft maintenance in accordance with the approved System of Certification. You will report to the Senior Engineer and Maintenance Leader and be required to make determinations in regards to major defects and discrepancies, recognise and report unsafe conditions and conduct certification and supervision of maintenance tasks.

You will be required to participate in the delivery of quality services whilst maintaining a safe work environment for yourself and fellow workers.

About You

To do this, you will be an appropriately licensed LAME on aircraft types maintained by Virgin Tech, have extensive industry experience in an aircraft maintenance role with the ability to display excellent analytical skills and have demonstrated supervisory experience.

You will also have a good working knowledge of HSE requirements, demonstrated experience in superior customer service practices and have the ability to communicate with all levels of the engineering team.

For your application to be considered you will need to provide copies of the following:
  • Certified true copy of B1 CASA Licence
  • Relative Type training certificate (737NG, A320)
  • Relative Difference training certificate (737NG, A320, if applicable)
  • Relative EGR Training certificates (if applicable)
  • CASR Part 145 recognised HF Initial Training

You must be able to demonstrate recent certification experience of a minimum of 6 months in the preceding 2 years. This can be demonstrated through either a letter from your current/previous QA manager advising the number, type and length of QA approvals held or by submitting your current/previous employer Company Approval statement.

This role is a permanent night shift.

Interested?

If you’re looking for your next challenge and would like to showcase your skills, apply now!

Industry

  • Airlines/Aviation
  • Aviation & Aerospace
  • Leisure, Travel & Tourism

Part-time

865191258:
[

Senior Advisor, Policy, Advocacy and Strategic Projects

Company Name Indigenous Business Australia Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 40 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

IBA Level 6 (Salary range $108,566-$120,529)


Open only to Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants.
\xa0

Melbourne or Perth (Darwin considered)
\xa0\xa0

Role


role will involve being a senior member of a small team focused on providing strategic policy advice, driving policy reform submissions, developing the internal thought leadership and capability of IBA to influence the sector. The role will require working across IBA program areas, external agencies, research agencies and with Indigenous groups. The team’s duties include policy review, national and international development research, Indigenous procurement and land-based trends and inter-agency collaboration.


The role will use the results of research and impact to advocate for policy reform and provide thought leadership on topics impacting the Indigenous Affairs agenda. The measure of success will be an increase in the participation and visibility of proactive, well-researched strategic projects that result in more Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander families, businesses and organisations leading the dialogue on Indigenous Economic Development.


The position will report to the Senior Manager, Policy, Advocacy and Strategic Projects.


This position is being advertised under provisions of the Racial Discrimination Act that enable special measures to identify particular opportunities as open only to Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants.


KEY AREAS OF ACCOUNTABILITY (duties include but are not limited to):


Policy

• Assisting to lead the research and development of policy positions for a range of portfolio areas, including providing advice and briefs on government bills and policy proposals from other stakeholders and non-government organisations.
• Assisting to lead the development of strategy and policies on economic development and financial exclusion issues impact Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.
• Assisting provide advice to the IBA Chair, Board and Executive in duties including drafting speeches, briefings and questions.
• Engaging with key strategic stakeholders and community groups.
• Assisting in responding to correspondence from other areas of IBA, Indigenous communities and other agencies as required.
• Managing analysis and recommendation of options, as well as input into policy papers for the IBA Board and Executive.
• Providing specialist knowledge of the regulatory framework along with advocacy of IBA’s purpose and functions with the aim of promoting and encouraging self-management, self-sufficiency and economic independence for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples.
• Research, develop and present IBA policy papers, discussion pieces, positions and responses, including the identification of emerging risks, opportunities and issues.
• Assisting position IBA as the go-to organisation for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander economic development solutions.

Strategic Projects
• Assisting to lead the development of a framework to identify, qualify and articulate IBA’s social and economic impact including a measure to understand IBA’s Return on Mandate as well as Return on Investment;
• Identifying, establishing and strengthening sustainable relationships with key strategic IBA stakeholders, customers and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander entities, groups, communities and individuals.
• Using results from research along with requests from Indigenous stakeholders, assist to identify strategic projects and IBA’s response to such projects which deliver unique opportunities to promote and encourage self-management, self-sufficiency and economic independence for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples.
• Strategic project management and delivery.
• Technical project research, analysis, design and implementation requiring knowledge and experience in consumer lending and its regulations, systems requirements and Indigenous home ownership policies and procedures.


REQUIRED CAPABILITIES (Selection Criteria):
These are essential unless otherwise indicated.

Skills and attributes
• Excellent strategic and analytical skills and expertise with demonstrated success in applying these to strategic projects and/or policy development.
• At least 5 years’ experience in social policy or advocacy work in Australia, preferably with a focus on Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and issues
• Strong research and policy analysis skills, including the ability to analyse complex policy issues and develop evidence-based recommendations for the benefit of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.
• Experience in researching, gathering and understanding intelligence from national and international economic development forums, discussions and publications to participate in (and provide strategic input into) the development of new products and services, and initiatives designed to refine IBA’s existing products and services.
• Demonstrated experience building relationships and engagements and collaborating with existing and prospective stakeholders, customers, and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander entities, groups, communities and individuals
• Ability to achieve results and provide leadership as an integral member of a small results focused, deadline driven, multi-disciplinary team.

Knowledge and experience
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to adapt writing style for a range of audiences and products including government submissions, private policy briefs, public position statements and the media.
• A sound knowledge and understanding of Indigenous economic development frameworks.
• Knowledge and understanding of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander culture and experience in engaging and working with Aboriginal & Torres Strait Islander communities is highly desirable.
• Relevant undergraduate or postgraduate qualifications (e.g. humanities, social sciences, politics, economics, law or another related discipline).


To apply, go to\xa0http://www.iba.gov.au/careers/current-vacancies/2061-senioradvisor/\xa0

Applications close 27 September 2018


Further Enquiries Contact

\xa0Jonathan Kneebone on 0491 211 337 or email: jonathan.kneebone@iba.gov.au

865167372:
[

Project Officer, Preventing Violence Against Women

Company Name Municipal Association of Victoria Company Location Level 12, 60 Collins Street , Melbourne, VIC 3000, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 271 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Municipal Association of Victoria (MAV) is the peak representative body for Victorian councils. Our services include policy advice and advocacy; capacity building programs including networking events and topic-based workshops; and we facilitate strengthened relationships with other levels of government, industry bodies and members.


We are seeking to employ a passionate and capable Project Officer to support our work with the local government sector in preventing violence against women. This is a 12-month, four days per week position funded by the State Government through the Office for Women.


We would love to hear from you if you have:

  • tertiary qualifications related to social policy, gender studies and/or relevant work experience
  • an interest in and/or understanding of local government
  • an understanding of primary prevention
  • a willingness to learn and seek professional development opportunities in social policy or the prevention of violence against women

\xa0

This position will contribute to local government building capability and capacity in the prevention of violence against women and promotion of gender equality, including strengthening partnerships between councils, service systems and community organisations. The role will require the development and maintenance of communication, provision of information and resources and networking opportunities.


The Project Officer will support the Policy Adviser, Prevention of Violence Against Women and develop and distribute fortnightly communications with the local government sector and key partners; provide support to local government officers; assist with the development of policy responses, submissions, and grants relating to gender equality and the prevention of family violence, and provide administrative assistance for the portfolio within the MAV.


A salary in the range of $60,000 – $70,000 plus 9.5% superannuation and pro-rata for four days ($48,000 - $56,000 plus superannuation) will be negotiated with the successful applicant based on skills and experience.


Download the position description from the MAV website, www.mav.asn.au for further details and information on how to apply for this role.\xa0


Note that applications that do not address the key selection criteria will not be considered.

\xa0

Applications are due by on Wednesday 26 September 2018 by\xa05.00pm.

\xa0

For further information about the role contact Kellie Nagle on 03 9667 5585.


\xa0

865157707:
[

Compliance & Risk Officer

Company Name Good Shepherd Microfinance Company Location Level 11, 350 Queen Street, Melbourne, VIC 3000, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 82 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Looking to share your compliance expertise in a purpose-driven environment?
  • Don’t miss this prime opportunity to shape our compliance framework from the ground-up!
  • Flexible, part-time option based in the CBD

\xa0

Join a high performing team with heart!

Good Shepherd Microfinance is a world leader in financial inclusion products, services and advisory. We offer fair and affordable financial programs to people on low incomes and advisory services for governments, businesses and other organisations. Our purpose is to enable economic wellbeing for people on low incomes, especially women and girls.

\xa0

What will be your key focus?

Reporting to the Finance Manager and sitting within the Finance and Admin Team, you will work independently across the organisation and closely with internal and external stakeholders (including Board Members and Senior Managers) to provide expert advice and recommendations. You will manage the development and implementation of an organisation-wide risk and compliance framework to facilitate management and monitoring of all compliance requirements.

\xa0

What will you need to succeed?

  1. Subject matter expertise in compliance and regulatory requirements, particularly in relation to holding an Australian Credit Licence
  2. Experience in developing and implementing compliance frameworks, reporting and monitoring – including knowledge of off-the-shelf compliance management software
  3. Strong verbal communication skills and previous success engaging effectively with stakeholders at all levels and external partners and agencies
  4. Strong written communication skills and demonstrated experience communicating technical information clearly and concisely, writing and editing policies and procedural documents, Board papers and reports
  5. Legal, regulatory, banking or compliance background is highly regarded as is experience working or volunteering for a NFP or community organisation
  6. Knowledge of risk management frameworks
  7. The capacity and commitment to work in alignment with the values of Good Shepherd Microfinance

\xa0

More about us?

Our Finance and Admin Team are a newly formed crew of dedicated and highly-caffeinated professionals. They love a laugh and they get to partner with all parts of our amazing organisation, who help people in the community realise their economic wellbeing, every day!

At the core of our team are our values and a culture that invests strongly in professional development, workplace flexibility and employee wellbeing. In 2016, we were ranked in the top 10 most innovative not-for-profits in Australia and our work is growing! Our team has nearly doubled over the last couple of years and we’re proud that women make up 66% of management and to have team engagement scores that are some of the highest nationally. In addition, our remuneration includes generous salary packaging benefits that can increase take home pay.

\xa0

Interested? To learn more about us and to download the position description, visit www.goodshepherdmicrofinance.org.au/careers. For further information and queries, contact Samantha Kinmond, Finance Manager at SKinmond@gsmicrofinance.org.au

\xa0

To apply send your resume and a cover letter to: careers@gsmicrofinance.org.au by 5pm Sunday 23rd September 2018. Your cover letter should tell us why you want to work with us, why you see yourself in this role and how you believe you meet the criteria outlined in the points above (also in the Position Description).

\xa0

We recognise the rich diversity of people across Australia. We are committed to ensuring that our team is reflective of the diverse community we serve and to supporting a culture of equity, inclusion and diversity.

866342090:
[

Senior Accountant

Company Name GOLD FIELDS Company Location Gruyere, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 79 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Gruyere gold deposit in Western Australia is one of Australia’s most exciting new gold projects. Gold Road Resources and Gold Fields are proud to have an established 50/50 JV partnership over Gruyere. With Gold Fields as the JV manager, the team at Gruyere have hit the ground running and are working hard to achieve first gold production in 2019.

Role Details

Reporting to the Commercial Manager, you will be responsible for all financial matters in relation to Gruyere Mine. You shall be regarded as a cost leader and have a dynamic approach to overseeing the day to day affairs as a back to back to the Commercial Manager. The Commercial portfolio is responsible for; Finance and Planning; Supply Warehouse; Camp & Flights and IT. The candidate will also be a dedicated business analyst and have direct end of month accounting responsibilities across the site.

This role is offered on 8 days on and 6 days off and is Fly In Fly Out from Perth. Flexibility around this roster will be required initially, details of which will be discussed with applicants who progress to the interview stage.

Key Responsibilities Will Include
  • Always act in a manner that seeks to enhance the strong safety culture and performance of Gold Fields and ensures that the Vital Behaviours program is supported and strengthened.
  • Oversee day to day aspects of the Commercial department when the Commercial Manager is not on site. This includes IT, Flights, Supply, Village management, and site finance and business analysis.
  • Coordination, preparation and analysis for budgeting and forecasting, also including continuous improvement of analytical reporting models and forecasting tools.
  • Dedicated commercial support to operations where a high level of technical business analysis is required to drive business improvements.
  • Key resource in supporting the Commercial Manager in coordinating the annual LOM strategic business plan with detailed quality business analytics.
  • Contract supervision of Camp services contractor monthly KPI's and managing day to day issues as they arise in partnership with the Site Administration.
  • Contribute to company and statutory compliance obligations ensuring Sarbanes Oxley standards are met through the generation of quality reports through the input of physicals on a regular basis as directed.


Key Factors To Your Success Include
  • Bachelor of Commerce; Accounting or recognised Tertiary Qualifications.
  • Diploma in Front Line Management is an asset.
  • Experience in JV Accounting would be advantageous.
  • A CPA or CA Qualification would be highly regarded.
  • 8 years' experience in a financial role within a mining environment, previous supervisory experience would be highly desirable.
  • Advanced Microsoft skills and computer literacy.
  • Demonstrated knowledge of ERP systems – SAP and Xeras Experience would be advantageous.

Seniority Level

Associate

Industry

  • Construction
  • Mining & Metals
  • Oil & Energy

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Accounting/Auditing
  • Finance
